AboutMe: My name is Taahir Du Toit, and I am passionate about technology, particularly in the fields of web development and data engineering. I believe in living an integrated lifestyle, approaching everything holistically, and applying all that I learn.

I started teaching myself to code at the age of 12 after being fascinated by the endless control the digital realm has to offer. Since then, I've expanded my skills from coding to video editing,some basic programming and more.
In my free time, I enjoy playing pool, surfing, spending time with friends and family, learning new skills, and reading. I am outgoing and thrive on meeting new people and exploring new activities.
Diligence and focus are important to me. I approach tasks systematically to ensure comprehensive coverage. I excel in communication and thrive in team environments.
Let's get together! I'd love the opportunity to get to know you too;)

Projects.name: E-Commerce
Projects.description: This was my first website. It taught me a lot and I had a lot of fun building it. I used HTML, Css and Javascript

Projects.name: Hulu
Projects.description: This was one of my first HTML and CSS exercises. It taught me about alignment and the importance of approaching web developement in a systematic order

Projects.name: Lippy Llama
Projects.description: This is a project I created during the time I was self-learning html and css. I learnt the proper use of flex box while there was still a lot of area for growth.

Projects.name: Books - vue
Projects.description: This was my first vue project. I used it to explore everything I learnt. I got to use v-directives, methods, the data function, props and slots. Good fun

Projects.name: Hangman
Projects.description: This was a fun exercise i used to test my ability. It helped me improve my debugging and problem solving skills. It also integrates an api to get a random word which was something I found challenging at the time.I show it to friends and family and it seems to be just the right level of difficulty that people keep playing it.

Projects.name: To Do App
Projects.description: This is a tool that I use almost daily. I created it to consolodate work that was taught at Life Choices. I plan to link it to an database once I learn the CRUD method so that it can be used as a journal to look back at your progress

education.description: I participated in a range of extra-cirricular activities including athletics, rugby and nasheed
This was  a six month course in which I further developed my full-stack abilities, soft-skills and met some amazing people along the way

testimonials.name: Akhil Hansjee
testimonials.message: “Taahir is ambitous, hardworking, dedicated and eager to learn. He is always taking on extra responsibility.”

testimonials.name: Akhona Mjikelo
testimonials.message: “Working with Taahir has been an absolute pleasure. His drive and hard work for excellence is truly inspiring. You can tell he is passionate about helping others because whenever I need guidance, he generously shares his time and knowledge, ensuring that I am not left behind.  His supportive nature makes him a great colleague and friend.”

testimonials.name: Elvin Harris
testimonials.message: “It's been a pleasure having Taahir in my software development class. He's an incredibly quick learner who always seems to grasp new concepts with ease. But what truly sets him apart is his willingness to share his knowledge with others. He explains things clearly and patiently, making even complex topics understandable. His passion for coding is contagious, and it motivates everyone around him to learn more.”

testimonials.name: Caleb Okkers
testimonials.message: “I am grateful to call Taahir a close friend. He has great work ethic, analytical and problem solving skills. He thrives in collaborative settings as well as when he works on his own. He motivates me to work because both actively and by the outcomes of his work. He is kind, generous and hilarious. Taahir would be a valuable asset to any organization.”
